sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: From April 24th, Bulgaria will ban imports of Ukrainian grain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's the fourth EU member to introduce a unilateral ban to protect its own harvests and cereal markets, a trend causing embarrassment in Brussels, which aims to project a supportive stance towards the war-torn country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But for Bulgaria and others, charity begins at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We have products worth several billion, which we believe that if we do not take additional measures, it will be difficult to implement on the market and we will suffer very serious losses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Romania is also considering a ban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For the moment, its Minister of Agriculture has announced that Romania will intensify checks on grain imported from Ukraine. Trucks will be sealed and monitored by GPS during transit through the country. The EU has rushed to quell the revolt, arguing for a common European approach, as customs policy should be united across the block. You will recall that we have already provided a support package of 56.3 million euros for the most affected farmers and we are now preparing a second financial support package of 100 million euros. On Wednesday Poland decided to partially lift its ban, but only to allow transit across its territory, not the sale of Ukrainian grain on it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of trucks laden with Ukrainian grain had been stranded at the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Amid criticism of his controversial pension reform, the French president visited rural France hoping to calm tensions and move forward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's not saucepans that are going to allow France to move forward, said Emmanuel Macron when asked about the protests to his reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some demonstrators greeted him with whistles and banging pans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Others gave him a piece of their mind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, Macron will be visiting a school in the Airoil region to discuss education.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After three months of protests and anger, last Friday the government passed the law that will raise the pension age from 62 to 64.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Fighting in Sudan enters its sixth day as a ceasefire between the army and the powerful paramilitary group the Rapid Support Forces failed. This is the second ceasefire between the army and the powerful paramilitary group, the rapid support forces, failed. This is the second ceasefire they've broken. Thousands of residents have fled the capital Khartoum. So have some 320 soldiers who were detained in neighboring Chad. The violent clashes have already left more than 270 civilians dead and more than 2,000 injured, according to the World Health Organization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Europe experienced its second warmest year ever recorded in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Copernicus Climate Change Service annual report shows that Europe also saw its hottest summer on record last year, at 1.4 degrees Celsius above the recent average, compounded by several extreme events.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Temperatures are rising at twice the global average rate, faster than any other continent. Much of Europe suffered intense and prolonged heat waves, with southern Europe being specially affected by very strong heat stress. Globally, the last eight years have been the warmest on record. Carbon emissions from summer wildfires were the highest in Carbon emissions from summer wildfires were the highest in 15 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The lack of winter snow and the high summer temperatures resulted in a record loss of 5 cubic kilometres of ice from glaciers in the Alps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The European Union is taking a huge step forwards when it comes to tackling environmental destruction, after the European Parliament voted on Wednesday to ensure that products on the EU market are deforestation-free.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Companies will very soon have to prove that what they sell has no link to deforestation from 2021 onwards, both in Europe and throughout the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The list includes, among other things, palm oil, coffee, soy and wood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The MEP in charge of the new law says the rules are a significant achievement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We are losing every year around 10 million hectares of forest all over the world and this instrument is going to hold that at least our part in the complicity in that deforestation because our shelves are currently filled with chocolate, coffee, etc., soy products that contribute massively to the forest destruction, around 10% of this 10 million yearly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Companies will have to provide information to the relevant EU authorities, like geolocation coordinates from which satellite images of the area can be assessed for any possible forest degradation or deforestation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: If they fail to comply with the rules, businesses can be fined.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Critics argue that the new measures will push up the cost of goods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: But the Greens in the European Parliament say this would only be in the short term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: ANA-MARIA BOUDOUIN, Member, European Parliament of the Netherlands What we try to push is to push for one economy towards another model of economy, an economy where we destroy the planet, where we destroy also conditions of life for a certain number of people, towards an economy where we do respect nature and people. And this can have, of course, a price that is felt on the consumers at start, but in a really short time this would change how the economy is structured and then the price wouldn't be so high for the people it was just be somehow a transition a shift towards another model protecting the rights of indigenous people is another requirement for products entering the EU market once the rules come into force businesses and traders will have 18 months to implement them, with smaller companies given longer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Krista Pichers for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Earth, Moon and Sun lined up perfectly, with the Moon covering the Sun, causing a rare type of total solar eclipse called a hybrid solar eclipse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It was seen through telescopes at the Perth Observatory and Lehmann Solar Observatory, south of Exmouth on the west coast of Australia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the early morning of Thursday, people gathered in Australia, Indonesia and East Timor to watch the phenomenon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It occurs just a handful of times every 100 years.
